what: Convenience wrapper on bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() and bcdata::collect() to retrieve Web Feature Service data from the BC Data Catalogue. — rfp_bcd_get_data
title: Convenience wrapper on bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() and bcdata::collect() to retrieve Web Feature Service data from the BC Data Catalogue. — rfp_bcd_get_data
text: function queries geospatial data BC Data Catalogue using specified record ID. conditionally filters data based provided column identifier value(s), selects specific columns, cleans column names. Geometry object returned can dropped desired

title: Convenience wrapper on bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() and bcdata::collect() to retrieve Web Feature Service data from the BC Data Catalogue. — rfp_bcd_get_data
code: rfp_bcd_get_data(   bcdata_record_id,   col_extract = NULL,   drop_geom = FALSE,   col_filter = NULL,   col_filter_value = NULL )

title: Convenience wrapper on bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() and bcdata::collect() to retrieve Web Feature Service data from the BC Data Catalogue. — rfp_bcd_get_data
text: bcdata_record_id character string specifying BC Data Catalogue record ID permanent id (7ecfafa6-5e18-48cd-8d9b-eae5b5ea2881), name record (pscis-assessments) object name (ex. WHSE_FISH.PSCIS_ASSESSMENT_SVW).  name record can found https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/.  need capitals convert capitals within function. col_extract character vector specifying columns select data. NULL. drop_geom logical value indicating whether drop geometry column sf object. Default FALSE col_filter character string specifying column identifier filter data . NULL (default), filtering applied. Colunn name converted upper case supplied format. col_filter_value character character vector specifying values filter col_filter . NULL (default), filtering col_filter applied.olunn name converted upper case supplied format.

title: Convenience wrapper on bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() and bcdata::collect() to retrieve Web Feature Service data from the BC Data Catalogue. — rfp_bcd_get_data
text: data frame cleaned names optionally sf object.

title: Convenience wrapper on bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() and bcdata::collect() to retrieve Web Feature Service data from the BC Data Catalogue. — rfp_bcd_get_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ rfp_bcd_get_data(bcdata_record_id = "7ecfafa6-5e18-48cd-8d9b-eae5b5ea2881", col_filter = 'FUNDING_PROJECT_NUMBER', col_filter_value = 'skeena_2023_Phase1', col_extract = c('EXTERNAL_CROSSING_REFERENCE', 'STREAM_CROSSING_ID'), drop_geom = TRUE) rfp_bcd_get_data(bcdata_record_id = "bc-airports", col_extract = c('AIRPORT_NAME', 'DESCRIPTION')) # Retrieves all records without filtering on col_filter } # }

what: Backup a file with optional timestamp — rfp_fs_backup
title: Backup a file with optional timestamp — rfp_fs_backup
text: Copies specified file backup directory, optionally appending timestamp.

title: Backup a file with optional timestamp — rfp_fs_backup
code: rfp_fs_backup(   path_dir_in,   path_in_file,   path_dir_out,   stamp = format(Sys.time(), "%Y%m%d%H%M") )

title: Backup a file with optional timestamp — rfp_fs_backup
text: path_dir_in Character. Directory input file. path_in_file Character. Name input file. path_dir_out Character. Directory backup stored. stamp Character NULL. Optional string append filename. Defaults current timestamp.

title: Backup a file with optional timestamp — rfp_fs_backup
text: Character. Full path newly created backup file.

title: Backup a file with optional timestamp — rfp_fs_backup
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ path_dir_in <- "~/Projects/gis/sern_peace_fwcp_2023" path_in_file <- "background_layers.gpkg" path_dir_out <- "~/Projects/gis/backups" rfp_fs_backup(path_dir_in, path_in_file, path_dir_out) } # }

what: Convert all layers in a GeoPackage to GeoJSON files — rfp_gpkg_to_geojson
title: Convert all layers in a GeoPackage to GeoJSON files — rfp_gpkg_to_geojson
text: function reads layers GeoPackage file writes GeoJSON files. use geojsons make mapping convenient update automagically QGIS without restart b/c wsg84 display default github web platforms

title: Convert all layers in a GeoPackage to GeoJSON files — rfp_gpkg_to_geojson
code: rfp_gpkg_to_geojson(   dir_in = "~/test",   dir_out = "~/test",   file_name_in = "gps_2024" )

title: Convert all layers in a GeoPackage to GeoJSON files — rfp_gpkg_to_geojson
text: dir_in character string representing directory GeoPackage located. Default "~/test". dir_out character string representing directory GeoJSON files saved. Default "~/test". file_name_in character string name GeoPackage file (without extension). Default "gps_2024".

what: Import GPX Waypoints and Tracks directly from a GPS plugged into a Mac. — rfp_gpx_import
title: Import GPX Waypoints and Tracks directly from a GPS plugged into a Mac. — rfp_gpx_import
text: function reads GPX files specified directories, extracts waypoints tracks, saves specified formats based provided time filters.

title: Import GPX Waypoints and Tracks directly from a GPS plugged into a Mac. — rfp_gpx_import
code: rfp_gpx_import(   dir_gpx_waypoints = "/Volumes/GARMIN/Garmin/GPX/",   dir_gpx_tracks = c("/Volumes/GARMIN/Garmin/GPX/Archive/",     "/Volumes/GARMIN/Garmin/GPX/Current/"),   dir_out = "~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Personal/Projects/2024_data/gps",   time_start = "2024-01-01",   time_end = "2099-01-01",   layer_output_name = "2024_ai",   gpkg_name = "gps_2024",   dates_view = FALSE,   gpx_layer_type = c("waypoints", "tracks", "track_points") )

title: Import GPX Waypoints and Tracks directly from a GPS plugged into a Mac. — rfp_gpx_import
text: dir_gpx_waypoints character string specifying directory containing GPX waypoint files. Default '/Volumes/GARMIN/Garmin/GPX/'. dir_gpx_tracks character vector specifying directories containing GPX track files. Default c("/Volumes/GARMIN/Garmin/GPX/Archive/", "/Volumes/GARMIN/Garmin/GPX/Current/"). dir_out character string specifying directory save output files. Default '~/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Personal/Projects/2024_data/gps'. time_start character string representing start date filtering waypoints tracks based . waypoint created END time track (track automatically wrapped gps.  Default "2024-01-01". time_end character string representing end date filtering waypoints tracks based . waypoint created END time track (track automatically wrapped gps. Default "2099-01-01". layer_output_name character string specifying name layer export string append waypoint track name collisions occur specify surveyor. Default "2024_ai". appended layer's name (e.g., gps_waypoints_2024_ai.gpx). gpkg_name character string specifying filename GPKG export. Default "gps_2024". creates geopackage named gps_2024.gpkg. dates_view logical flag indicating whether display filtered waypoint dates pretty format terminal. Default FALSE. dates displayed terminal, output files generated. useful visualizing options setting time_start time_end params. gpx_layer_type character vector specifying types layers read GPX files. Default c("waypoints", "tracks", "track_points").  "routes" "route_points" untested.

title: Import GPX Waypoints and Tracks directly from a GPS plugged into a Mac. — rfp_gpx_import
text: None. function saves waypoints specified files optionally displays dates.

title: Import GPX Waypoints and Tracks directly from a GPS plugged into a Mac. — rfp_gpx_import
text: function allows user preview waypoint dates applying filters. dates_view set TRUE, display dates read GPX files without filtering. useful verifying data filter processed.

what: Function to create a lookup table for BC Data Catalogue — rfp_meta_bcd_xref
title: Function to create a lookup table for BC Data Catalogue — rfp_meta_bcd_xref
text: Function create lookup table BC Data Catalogue

title: Function to create a lookup table for BC Data Catalogue — rfp_meta_bcd_xref
code: rfp_meta_bcd_xref(pkg_exclude = c("bc-web-map-library"))

title: Function to create a lookup table for BC Data Catalogue — rfp_meta_bcd_xref
text: pkg_exclude character vector specifying packages exclude. Default c("bc-web-map-library"). package name associated several datasets wms download capabilities.

title: Function to create a lookup table for BC Data Catalogue — rfp_meta_bcd_xref
text: data frame columns object_name, package_name, url_browser, description, id_package, id_dataset, url_download.

title: Function to create a lookup table for BC Data Catalogue — rfp_meta_bcd_xref
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   lookup_table <- rfp_meta_bcd_xref()   head(lookup_table) } # }

title: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments
text: Check given schema_table column exist BC Data Catalogue WMS service. exist, returns dataframe information column.

title: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments
code: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments(schema_table, column)

title: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments
text: schema_table string. name schema_table check. column string. name column check.

title: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments
text: tibble information column exists. Information included character value schema_table provided, column name, R column type, column comments.

title: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ rfp_meta_bcd_xref_col_comments("whse_imagery_and_base_maps.gsr_airports_svw", "airport_name") } # }

what: Create a table that cross references the package name with the object_name. — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_pkg_schtab
title: Create a table that cross references the package name with the object_name. — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_pkg_schtab
text: Helper function used /linkrfp_meta_bcd_xref drill package get object_name resource_df using row index gathered rfp_meta_bcd_xref. used apply row index row contains wms resource within package datasets within package want schema.table dataset downloaded wms service.

title: Create a table that cross references the package name with the object_name. — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_pkg_schtab
code: rfp_meta_bcd_xref_pkg_schtab(pkg_list = NULL, pkg_name = NULL, row_idx = NULL)

title: Create a table that cross references the package name with the object_name. — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_pkg_schtab
text: pkg_list list complete metadata package. pkg_name character string specifying package name. row_idx numeric value specifying row index.

title: Create a table that cross references the package name with the object_name. — rfp_meta_bcd_xref_pkg_schtab
text: tibble columns object_name package_name.

what: Remove Metadata from a Photo — rfp_photo_metadata_rm
title: Remove Metadata from a Photo — rfp_photo_metadata_rm
text: function removes metadata specified photo file using exiftool. Optionally, can overwrite original file create backup.

title: Remove Metadata from a Photo — rfp_photo_metadata_rm
code: rfp_photo_metadata_rm(path_photo, overwrite_original = TRUE, log_output = TRUE)

title: Remove Metadata from a Photo — rfp_photo_metadata_rm
text: path_photo character string specifying path photo file. overwrite_original logical value indicating whether overwrite original photo file (default TRUE). FALSE, backup file suffix _original created. log_output Optionally produce tibble log output (default TRUE)

title: Remove Metadata from a Photo — rfp_photo_metadata_rm
text: None. function modifies specified file removing metadata.

title: Remove Metadata from a Photo — rfp_photo_metadata_rm
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   rfp_photo_metadata_rm("path/to/photo.jpg")    # many at the same time with no logging    list_of_photo_paths |> purrr::walk(rfp_photo_metadata_rm, log_output = FALSE)    # many at the same time with logging    log_df <- list_of_photo_paths |> purrr::map_dfr(rfp_photo_metadata_rm) } # }

what: Download and Save BC Data to GPKG — rfp_source_bcdata
title: Download and Save BC Data to GPKG — rfp_source_bcdata
text: Downloads layer BC Data Catalogue, optionally intersects mask, writes GeoPackage.

title: Download and Save BC Data to GPKG — rfp_source_bcdata
code: rfp_source_bcdata(   bcdata_record_id = NULL,   path_gpkg = NULL,   mask = NULL,   layer_name = NULL )

title: Download and Save BC Data to GPKG — rfp_source_bcdata
text: bcdata_record_id character character string specifying BC Data Catalogue record ID permanent id (7ecfafa6-5e18-48cd-8d9b-eae5b5ea2881), name record (pscis-assessments) object name (ex. WHSE_FISH.PSCIS_ASSESSMENT_SVW).  name record can found https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/.  need capitals convert capitals within function. path_gpkg character Path output GeoPackage file. mask sf::sf Optional masking polygon clip spatial extent. Can massively increase download speed first queries bbox api. layer_name character Optional layer name writing GPKG. Defaults bcdata_record_id.

what: Download and Convert CSVs to GeoPackage Layers — rfp_source_csv
title: Download and Convert CSVs to GeoPackage Layers — rfp_source_csv
text: function downloads CSV files specified URLs converts layers within GeoPackage using ogr2ogr command-line tool GDAL.

title: Download and Convert CSVs to GeoPackage Layers — rfp_source_csv
code: rfp_source_csv(path_gpkg, urls_csv)

title: Download and Convert CSVs to GeoPackage Layers — rfp_source_csv
text: path_gpkg string specifying path output GeoPackage file. urls_csv character vector URLs pointing CSV files downloaded converted.

title: Download and Convert CSVs to GeoPackage Layers — rfp_source_csv
text: Invisible NULL. function called side effects.

title: Download and Convert CSVs to GeoPackage Layers — rfp_source_csv
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ path_gpkg <- "background_layers.gpkg" urls_csv <- c(   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smnorris/bcfishpass/main/parameters/example_newgraph/parameters_habitat_method.csv",   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smnorris/bcfishpass/main/parameters/example_newgraph/parameters_habitat_thresholds.csv" ) rfp_source_csv(path_gpkg, urls_csv) } # }

what: Download and Convert Files to GeoPackage Layers with Optional Filtering — rfp_source_url
title: Download and Convert Files to GeoPackage Layers with Optional Filtering — rfp_source_url
text: function downloads files specified URLs converts layers within GeoPackage using ogr2ogr command-line tool GDAL. optionally applies SQL filter data conversion query specified.

title: Download and Convert Files to GeoPackage Layers with Optional Filtering — rfp_source_url
code: rfp_source_url(path_gpkg, urls, query = NULL)

title: Download and Convert Files to GeoPackage Layers with Optional Filtering — rfp_source_url
text: path_gpkg string specifying path output GeoPackage file. urls character vector URLs pointing files downloaded converted. query optional SQL query string filter data conversion process. NULL (default), filter applied.

title: Download and Convert Files to GeoPackage Layers with Optional Filtering — rfp_source_url
text: Invisible NULL. function called side effects.

title: Download and Convert Files to GeoPackage Layers with Optional Filtering — rfp_source_url
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ path_gpkg <- "background_layers.gpkg" urls <- c(   "https://newgraph.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/bcfishpass.crossings_vw.fgb",   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smnorris/bcfishpass/main/parameters/example_newgraph/parameters_habitat_thresholds.csv" ) query <- "watershed_group_code in ('ADMS', 'KLUM')" rfp_source_url(path_gpkg, urls, query) } # }

what: Remove Specified Layers from a GeoPackage — rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers
title: Remove Specified Layers from a GeoPackage — rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers
text: rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers() superseded favour gdalraster::ogr_layer_delete() function removes specified layers GeoPackage listing layers using sf::st_layers, recreating GeoPackage without specified layers using ogr2ogr commands executed via system2.

title: Remove Specified Layers from a GeoPackage — rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers
code: rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers(path_gpkg, layers_remove)

title: Remove Specified Layers from a GeoPackage — rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers
text: path_gpkg string specifying path GeoPackage file. layers_remove character vector naming layers removed GeoPackage.

title: Remove Specified Layers from a GeoPackage — rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers
text: Invisible NULL, indicating function used side effects.

title: Remove Specified Layers from a GeoPackage — rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   path_gpkg <- "path/to/your.gpkg"   layers_remove <- c("layer_to_remove1", "layer_to_remove2")   rfp_u_rm_gpkg_layers(path_gpkg, layers_remove) } # }
